item.title: About
item.description: I am a Solutions Architect and have created solutions architecture for large tenders for hybrid environments and on premise environments. I am certified Google Cloud Professional Cloud Architect, PSM I and PSPO I. I also graduated from Carnegie Mellon University’s Master of Entertainment Technology program. I have created a Prison Yard Virtual Reality (VR) simulator, a Crime Scene Investigation VR simulator and a bus driving simulator. These projects have been featured on The Straits Times and ChannelNewsAsia.

item.title: Ideas
item.description: Good ideas are hard to come by. And when you come across a good idea, you wonder why you never thought in that way before. Below in no particular order are ideas which changed how I thought about something. Where applicable, I will include the book I got the idea from and a brief description of why you might want to read it. Programming # Harold Abelson, Gerald Jay Sussman, Julie Sussman.

item.title: Software and Tech
item.description: Software and technology changes rapidly. I have noted below what I hope will still be useful in years to come. Writing Clean Code # Very generally, use the package manager use dependency injection create systems/services/components along meaningful boundaries. Test them assemble them until you have your application use CI/CD Personal Security # Use a password manager. Don’t let breaches expose your password to other accounts. Use 2FA where important TLS Security # https://ssl-config.

item.title: Games
item.description: Growing up, I enjoyed playing games over other forms of entertainment. Mainly because I could play and experience the story as an interactive fiction. Recent games I enjoyed were The Witcher 3 and Divinity Original Sin 2.
